title: Side Stand - Removal

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
If the engine has recently been running, the exhaust components can be hot.
Always allow the hot components to cool before working on the exhaust system.
Contact with the hot components could cause minor to moderate burns to exposed skin.
Wear hand, eye and face protection when unhooking the stand spring. Take great care to minimise the risk of personal injury and loss of components.
Compressed circlips are under tension and can cause injury if released suddenly.
Always wear suitable protective eye wear and release the circlip slowly.
Failure to wear protective eye wear may cause injury to the eyes.
Remove the side stand return spring
For removal of the side stand switch or magnet, see

search: Side Stand - Removal
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
If the engine has recently been running, the exhaust components can be hot.
Always allow the hot components to cool before working on the exhaust system.
Contact with the hot components could cause minor to moderate burns to exposed skin.
Perform the following operations:
Belly Pan - Removal
Front Sprocket Cover - Removal
Raise and support the motorcycle.
Wear hand, eye and face protection when unhooking the stand spring. Take great care to minimise the risk of personal injury and loss of components.
Compressed circlips are under tension and can cause injury if released suddenly.
Always wear suitable protective eye wear and release the circlip slowly.
Failure to wear protective eye wear may cause injury to the eyes.
Remove the side stand return spring
Remove and discard the circlip.
Remove the pivot pin.
Return spring
Pivot pin (circlip side)
Circlip
Pivot pin (head)
For removal of the side stand switch or magnet, see
Side Stand Switch - Removal
